title: How steel can go carbon neutral by 2030
text:
It’s impossible to imagine modern life without steel. Buildings would crumble, bridges would collapse, planes would be grounded, cars would be stationary, razors would be bladeless. It’s the fundamental building block of the industrial era, of modern civilisation as we know it – but it’s time to get serious about its future.

In many respects, steel is the most sustainable material of all – it’s 100pc recyclable and it’s essential for the construction of many of the linchpins of our green future including wind turbines and hydroelectric turbines, as well as electric vehicles.
